asteroglitch.models¶

Probabilistic models for asteroseismic oscillation mode frequencies.

class asteroglitch.models.GlitchModel(name, delta_nu, nu_max, epsilon=None, alpha=None, *, nu, nu_err=None, n=None, num_orders=None, num_pred=200)[source]¶

Bases: asteroglitch.models.Model

Parameters

  • delta_nu (Array1D[float]) – Two elements containing the respective prior mean and standard deviation for the large frequency separation.

  • nu_max (Array1D[float]) – Two elements containing the respective prior mean and standard deviation for the frequency at maximum power.

  • epsilon (Array1D[float]) – Two elements containing the respective prior mean and standard deviation for the asymptotic phase term. Default is [1.3, 0.2] which is suitable for main sequence solar-like oscillators.

  • alpha (Array1D[float]) – Two elements containing the respective prior mean and standard deviation for the asymptotic curvature term. Default is [0.0015, 0.002] which is suitable for most solar-like oscillators.

  • nu (Union[Array1D[float], Array2D[float]]) – Locations of the l=0 (radial) stellar pulsation modes. Null data may be passed as NaN. The shape of nu should be (num_orders,) or (N, num_orders) for N stars in the model.

  • nu_err (Optional[Union[Array1D[float], Array2D[float]]]) – The observational uncertainty for each element of nu. Null data may be passed as NaN. Default is None, for which only a star-by-star model error is inferred and observational uncertainty is assumed to be zero.

  • n (Optional[Array1D[int]]) – The observers radial order of each mode in nu. Default is None and n is inferred from num_orders.

  • num_orders (Optional[int]) – The number of radial orders to model. The observers n is inferred from the priors for delta_nu, nu_max and epsilon. Default is None, and num_orders is inferred from the length of the final dimension of nu.

circ_var_names: ClassVar[List[str]] = ['phi_he', 'phi_cz']¶

[description]

reparam: ClassVar[Dict[str, Reparam]] = {'phi_cz': <numpyro.infer.reparam.CircularReparam object>, 'phi_he': <numpyro.infer.reparam.CircularReparam object>}¶

[description]

class asteroglitch.models.Model(name, n, l=None, *, nu, nu_err=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base Model class for modelling asteroseismic oscillation modes.

All models must have a name (usually the name of the star), array of radial order n and array of angular degree l (optional). The observed mode frequencies nu must then be broadcastable to an array with shape num_stars x num_orders (x num_degrees). Optionally, the observed uncertainties may be passed with the same shape via nu_err. Any unobserved or null data should be passed as NaN, and an obs_mask will be made which can be used in the likelihood.

Parameters

  • name (Union[str, Array1D[str]]) – [description]

  • n (Array1D[int]) – [description]

  • nu (Union[Array1D[float], Array2D[float], Array3D[float]]) – [description]

  • l (Optional[Union[int, Array1D[int]]]) – [description]. Defaults to None.

  • nu_err (Optional[Union[Array1D[float], Array2D[float], Array3D[float]]]) – [description]. Defaults to None.

circ_var_names: ClassVar[List[str]] = []¶

[description]

class asteroglitch.models.dimension(name, size, subsample_size=None, dim=None, coords=None)[source]¶

Bases: numpyro.primitives.plate

Context manager for variables along a given dimension with coordinates.

Based on numpyro.plate but includes deterministics defined within the context.

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the dimension.

  • size (int) – Size of the dimension.

  • subsample_size (Optional[int]) – Optional argument denoting the size of the mini-batch. This can be used to apply a scaling factor by inference algorithms. e.g. when computing ELBO using a mini-batch.

  • dim (Optional[int]) – Optional argument to specify which dimension in the tensor is used as the plate dim. If None (default), the rightmost available dim is allocated.

  • coords (Optional[Array1D[Any]]) – Optional coordinates for each point in the dimension. If None (default), the coords are np.arange(size).

name¶

Name of the dimension

Type

str

size¶

Size of the dimension

Type

int

subsample_size¶

Size of the mini-batch.

Type

int or None

dim¶

The dimension in the tensor which is used as the plate dim.

Type

int or None

coords: numpy.ndarray¶

[description]

process_message(msg)[source]¶

Modified process message to also include deterministics.

Parameters

msg (Dict[str, Any]) – Process message

asteroglitch.models.estimate_n(num_orders, delta_nu, nu_max, epsilon)[source]¶

Estimates n from delta_nu, nu_max and epsilon, given num_orders about nu_max.
